title: Maxre
author: Maxre
content: Today I was reading news that F1 Racing has been started and Still there are a lot of companies are participating In Which Honda, McLaren, Redbull etc are participating and they are one a very high Road. As I was reading than I have seen that Redbull Company offers more to it's users and recently they have Landed plane on a Helipad. And that was insane. My question was that which Company do you like and actually which company is better actually?

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: There's no company that I really like but If I am going to bet which team will be the constructor champion for the 2023 season then I would still choose Red Bull Racing. They are just so dominant last season and they carried that momentum until now. I don't think Mercedes or Ferrari could catch up unless Max and Sergio would constantly crash into each other.

comments.author: Rabata
comments.body: The two names you have mentioned are the top performing team of both Formula 1 racing. These two teams have achieved significant success in sports several years. If I say according to the past information, then McLaren is ahead of the Red Bull because they have won 8 championships so far. Red Bull wins only 4. However Red Bull has won more drivers' championship than McLaren.In recent years, Red Bull has achieved more success than McLaren, especially with their driver Max Vertpen, who won multiple races and considered one of the top drivers of the sport. Both teams have the top drivers and they are able to win the race and championships. So certainly nothing can predict. However in my personal view i will corroborate Red Bull that has gained huge popularity in recent times.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 30, 2023, 01:34:17 PMMy question was that which Company do you like and actually which company is better actually?If you are talking about F1 racing and want to compare McLaren vs. Red Bull, both are like: your topic title (nice), but between McLaren and Red Bull have their own advantages in acting on the field during the race, whether it's the speed of the pitstop team and so on.I take an example of the F1 races in Mexico and Brazil, the actions taken by the two teams, the McLaren team at that time carried out the action of changing tires for Ricciardo's car in just 1.98 seconds, while the Red Bull team only took 1.82 seconds, it happened at two different F1 race locations, essentially: in a driver, mechanic, car race, the pitstop team etc., is the most important factor to determine the success of a race in the arena, from the experience I have seen from the past until now the Red Bull company has all of that, I'm not saying the other companies aren't good, but what I see is that Red Bull has an edge in every way, conclusion: Red Bull is better, that's based on experience and what I see and know.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: As a fan of McLaren I can tell you that McLaren is one of the iconic teams of F1 but that lately has been in a weak performance from many years and they are in this state since after 2010 or so and their last Championship won in F1 is in the distant year 2008 with Lewis Hamilton at that time.They are a good team with a great history but which unfortunately right now they are in a very bad shape and things do not look good either for the future races of this season.Redbull is an emerging team not with the history of McLaren but lately they are doing very well and they dominated from 2011 to 2014 with Vettel and now since 2021 with Verstappen.They are completely different as teams but things have changed dramatically a lot right now.For your question which is better it is a relative one and what could be better for me could be worse for you,however for me McLaren makes iconic road cars which Redbull does not and for me is better.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Redbull all the way. The performance that this team put out in previous seasons was nothing short of astounding so to speak. McLaren, although a good contender has never come close to beating Redbull (at least in my opinion) ever since 2010, so in this battle between two giants, I'd pick Redbull. This is highly opinionated and I know each team offers something to the table whether it be speed in the racetrack or speed in pitstop but so far, my money's gonna stay on Redbull.
